alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 4:02PM MST until August 16 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Areas near Blue Ridge in Coconino County, Arizona. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Overflowing poor drainage areas and ponding on area roadways may impact travel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Jacks Canyon and Clear Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Starlight Pines, Elks Group CG and Blue Ridge Campground. - This includes State Route 87 between mile markers 297 and 311. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
